input_text: to exploit these vulnerabilities via snmp version 2c or earlier , the attacker must know the snmp read-only community string for the affected system . an attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a crafted snmp packet to an affected system via ipv4 or ipv6 . the vulnerabilities are due to a buffer overflow condition in the snmp subsystem of the affected software . only traffic directed to an affected system can be used to exploit these vulnerabilities . the vulnerabilities affect all versions of snmp : versions 1 , 2c , and 3 . to exploit these vulnerabilities via snmp version 3 , the attacker must have user credentials for the affected system . all devices that have enabled snmp and have not explicitly excluded the affected mibs or oids should be considered vulnerable . the simple network management protocol ( snmp ) subsystem of cisco ios 12.0 through 12.4 and 15.0 through 15.6 and ios xe 2.2 through 3.17 contains multiple vulnerabilities that could allow an authenticated , remote attacker to remotely execute code on an affected system or cause an affected system to reload . cisco bug ids : cscve66658 .
target_text: in the simple network management protocol ( snmp ) subsystem of cisco ios 12.0 through 12.4 , and 15.0 through 15.6 , and ios xe 2.2 through 3.17 , buffer overflow is possible in the snmp subsytem via the snmp read-only community string for the affected system .

input_text: to exploit these vulnerabilities via snmp version 2c or earlier , the attacker must know the snmp read-only community string for the affected system . an attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a crafted snmp packet to an affected system via ipv4 or ipv6 . the vulnerabilities are due to a buffer overflow condition in the snmp subsystem of the affected software . only traffic directed to an affected system can be used to exploit these vulnerabilities . the vulnerabilities affect all versions of snmp : versions 1 , 2c , and 3 . to exploit these vulnerabilities via snmp version 3 , the attacker must have user credentials for the affected system . all devices that have enabled snmp and have not explicitly excluded the affected mibs or oids should be considered vulnerable . the simple network management protocol ( snmp ) subsystem of cisco ios 12.0 through 12.4 and 15.0 through 15.6 and ios xe 2.2 through 3.17 contains multiple vulnerabilities that could allow an authenticated , remote attacker to remotely execute code on an affected system or cause an affected system to reload . cisco bug ids : cscve66658 .

input_text: subject : gimp parser bugs ( flimp and more ) it seems overall the file format importers are unmaintained . i also tried to submit a fuzzing guide to the gimp wiki , which failed , because the people who are supposed to hand out user accounts don t answer . hi , see also background : in 2014 , back when i started the fuzzing project , i reported two bugs in gimp in their more obscure parsers . date : tue , 19 dec 2017 17:11:19 +0100 from : hanno b xc3 x83 xc2 xb6ck < hanno @ ... eck.de to : oss-security @ ... ts.openwall.com the bugs were ignored all the time , patches as well . i reported a couple of more bugs and also contacted the gnome security team . ( gimp is not fuzzing friendly . ) he also submitted a patch . the bugs : heap overflow in fli import ( the one where we have an exploit ) : oob read in tga ( with patch ) oob read in xcf ( patch , the only one that got merged and fixed ) oob read in gbr ( no patch , looks like string/utf8 issue ) heap overflow in psp ( no patch , doesn t look straightforward to fix ) oob read in psp ( no patch ) hanno b xc3 x83 xc2 xb6ck mail/jabber : hanno @ ... eck.de gpg : fe73757fa60e4e21b937579fa5880072bbb51e42 some have patches , others not , ony one got handled . recently i was contacted by tobias st xc3 x83 xc2 xb6ckmann who wrote a working exploit ( on freebsd < - no aslr , thus easier ) for one of those bugs in the flic parser . subject : gimp parser bugs ( flimp and more )
target_text: heap-based buffer overflow is possible via the fli_read_brun function of plug-ins/file-fli/fli.c

input_text: a remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way affected microsoft scripting engines render when handling objects in memory in microsoft browsers . these vulnerabilities could corrupt memory in such a way that an attacker could execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user . an attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the current user . an attacker could then install programs ; view , change , or delete data ; or create new accounts with full user rights . if the current user is logged on with administrative user rights , an attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could take control of an affected system . this vulnerability is different from those described in cve-2017-0010 , cve-2017-0032 , cve-2017-0035 , cve-2017-0067 , cve-2017-0070 , cve-2017-0071 , cve-2017-0094 , cve-2017-0131 , cve-2017-0132 , cve-2017-0133 , cve-2017-0134 , cve-2017-0136 , cve-2017-0137 , cve-2017-0138 , cve-2017-0141 , cve-2017-0150 , and cve-2017-0151 .
target_text: microsoft browsers microsoft scripting engines

input_text: to exploit these vulnerabilities via snmp version 2c or earlier , the attacker must know the snmp read-only community string for the affected system . an attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a crafted snmp packet to an affected system via ipv4 or ipv6 . the vulnerabilities are due to a buffer overflow condition in the snmp subsystem of the affected software . only traffic directed to an affected system can be used to exploit these vulnerabilities . the vulnerabilities affect all versions of snmp : versions 1 , 2c , and 3 . to exploit these vulnerabilities via snmp version 3 , the attacker must have user credentials for the affected system . all devices that have enabled snmp and have not explicitly excluded the affected mibs or oids should be considered vulnerable . the simple network management protocol ( snmp ) subsystem of cisco ios 12.0 through 12.4 and 15.0 through 15.6 and ios xe 2.2 through 3.17 contains multiple vulnerabilities that could allow an authenticated , remote attacker to remotely execute code on an affected system or cause an affected system to reload . cisco bug ids : cscve66658 .
target_text: simple network management protocol ( snmp ) subsystem of cisco ios 12.0 through 12.4 15.0 through 15.6 ios xe 2.2 through 3.17

input_text: the cisco waas could drop ica traffic while the process is restarting . an attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted ica traffic through the targeted device . cisco bug ids : cscve74457 . a vulnerability in the independent computing architecture ( ica ) accelerator feature for the cisco wide area application services ( waas ) could allow an unauthenticated , remote attacker to cause an ica application optimization-related process to restart , resulting in a partial denial of service ( dos ) condition . a successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause a dos condition that is due to a process unexpectedly restarting . this vulnerability affects cisco wide area application services ( waas ) and cisco virtual wide area application services ( vwaas ) . the vulnerability is due to improperly aborting a connection when an unexpected protocol packet is received .
target_text: in cisco waas and cisco vwaas a partial denial of service is possible as cisco waas could rdop ica traffic while the process is restarting, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted ica traffic through the targeted device

input_text: subject : gimp parser bugs ( flimp and more ) it seems overall the file format importers are unmaintained . i also tried to submit a fuzzing guide to the gimp wiki , which failed , because the people who are supposed to hand out user accounts don t answer . hi , see also background : in 2014 , back when i started the fuzzing project , i reported two bugs in gimp in their more obscure parsers . date : tue , 19 dec 2017 17:11:19 +0100 from : hanno b xc3 x83 xc2 xb6ck < hanno @ ... eck.de to : oss-security @ ... ts.openwall.com the bugs were ignored all the time , patches as well . i reported a couple of more bugs and also contacted the gnome security team . ( gimp is not fuzzing friendly . ) he also submitted a patch . the bugs : heap overflow in fli import ( the one where we have an exploit ) : oob read in tga ( with patch ) oob read in xcf ( patch , the only one that got merged and fixed ) oob read in gbr ( no patch , looks like string/utf8 issue ) heap overflow in psp ( no patch , doesn t look straightforward to fix ) oob read in psp ( no patch ) hanno b xc3 x83 xc2 xb6ck mail/jabber : hanno @ ... eck.de gpg : fe73757fa60e4e21b937579fa5880072bbb51e42 some have patches , others not , ony one got handled . recently i was contacted by tobias st xc3 x83 xc2 xb6ckmann who wrote a working exploit ( on freebsd < - no aslr , thus easier ) for one of those bugs in the flic parser . subject : gimp parser bugs ( flimp and more )

input_text: subsequently skb_copy_and_csum_bits ( ) writes out-of-bounds . however in between two send ( ) calls , the append path can be switched from ufo to non-ufo one , which leads to a memory corruption . a similar issue is present in ipv6 code . when building a ufo packet with msg_more ip_append_data ( ) calls ip_ufo_append_data ( ) to append . fraggap can exceed mtu , causing copy = datalen - transhdrlen - fraggap to become negative . in case ufo packet lengths exceeds mtu , copy = maxfraglen - skb- > len becomes negative on the non-ufo path and the branch to allocate new skb is taken . linux kernel : exploitable memory corruption due to ufo to non-ufo path switch . the bug was introduced in e89e9cf539a2 ( [ ipv4/ipv6 ] : ufo scatter-gather approach ) on oct 18 2005 . this triggers fragmentation and computation of fraggap = skb_prev- > len - maxfraglen .
target_text: memory corruption is possible via ufo to non-ufo path switch by switching append path between two send ( ) calls .

input_text: subject : gimp parser bugs ( flimp and more ) it seems overall the file format importers are unmaintained . i also tried to submit a fuzzing guide to the gimp wiki , which failed , because the people who are supposed to hand out user accounts don t answer . hi , see also background : in 2014 , back when i started the fuzzing project , i reported two bugs in gimp in their more obscure parsers . date : tue , 19 dec 2017 17:11:19 +0100 from : hanno b xc3 x83 xc2 xb6ck < hanno @ ... eck.de to : oss-security @ ... ts.openwall.com the bugs were ignored all the time , patches as well . i reported a couple of more bugs and also contacted the gnome security team . ( gimp is not fuzzing friendly . ) he also submitted a patch . the bugs : heap overflow in fli import ( the one where we have an exploit ) : oob read in tga ( with patch ) oob read in xcf ( patch , the only one that got merged and fixed ) oob read in gbr ( no patch , looks like string/utf8 issue ) heap overflow in psp ( no patch , doesn t look straightforward to fix ) oob read in psp ( no patch ) hanno b xc3 x83 xc2 xb6ck mail/jabber : hanno @ ... eck.de gpg : fe73757fa60e4e21b937579fa5880072bbb51e42 some have patches , others not , ony one got handled . recently i was contacted by tobias st xc3 x83 xc2 xb6ckmann who wrote a working exploit ( on freebsd < - no aslr , thus easier ) for one of those bugs in the flic parser . subject : gimp parser bugs ( flimp and more )

input_text: sap download manager 2.1.142 and earlier generates an encryption key from a small key space on windows and mac systems , which allows context-dependent attackers to obtain sensitive configuration information by leveraging knowledge of a hardcoded key in the program code and a computer bios serial number , aka sap security note 2282338 .
target_text: in sap download manager 2.1.142 and earlier , gaining information is possible via leveraging knowledge of a hardcoded key in the program code and a computer bios serial number .

input_text: buffer overflows in ascdc afterstep while running setuid allows local users to gain root privileges via a long ( 1 ) -d option , ( 2 ) -m option , or ( 3 ) -f option .

input_text: microsoft internet explorer 6 through 9 does not properly use the content-disposition http header to control rendering of the http response body , which allows remote attackers to read content from a different ( 1 ) domain or ( 2 ) zone via a crafted web site , aka content-disposition information disclosure vulnerability .
target_text: gaining information is possible via a crafted web site .

input_text: buffer overflow in the still image service in windows 2000 allows local users to gain additional privileges via a long wm_user message , aka the still image service privilege escalation vulnerability .
target_text: gaining privileges is possible via a long wm_user message , aka the still image service privilege escalation vulnerability .

input_text: it was found that the ajp connector in undertow , as shipped in jboss eap 7.1.0.ga , does not use the allow_encoded_slash option and thus allow the the slash / anti-slash characters encoded in the url which may lead to path traversal and result in the information disclosure of arbitrary local files .
